paper.title: A Particle Swarm Optimized Fuzzy Neural Network for Credit Risk Evaluation
paper.abstract: Neural networks (NNs) have been widely used to financial risk management because of their excellent performances of treating non-linear data with self-learning capability. However,the shortcoming of neural networks is also significant due to a black box syndrome and the difficulty in dealing with qualitative information, which limited its applications in practice. To overcome these drawbacks of NNs, in this study a particle swarm optimized fuzzy neural network(PSO-FNN) are proposed to evaluate credit risk. the results indicate that the predictive accuracies obtained from PSO-FNN are much higher than the ones obtained from NNs. To make this clearer, an illustrative example is also demonstrated in this study.

domain_result.justification: The paper focuses on evaluating credit risk using a particle swarm optimized fuzzy neural network, which is a specific application within the domain of financial risk management, particularly in assessing the likelihood of default or creditworthiness.
